user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_connection_set_nodelay_state_:
```c
bool
MHD_connection_set_nodelay_state_ (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                                   bool nodelay_state)
{
#ifdef TCP_NODELAY
  const MHD_SCKT_OPT_BOOL_ off_val = 0;
  const MHD_SCKT_OPT_BOOL_ on_val = 1;
  int err_code;

  if (_MHD_YES == connection->is_nonip)
    return false;

  if (0 == setsockopt (connection->socket_fd,
                       IPPROTO_TCP,
                       TCP_NODELAY,
                       (const void *) (nodelay_state ? &on_val : &off_val),
                       sizeof (off_val)))
  {
    connection->sk_nodelay = nodelay_state;
    return true;
  }

  err_code = MHD_socket_get_error_ ();
  if (MHD_SCKT_ERR_IS_ (err_code, MHD_SCKT_EINVAL_) ||
      MHD_SCKT_ERR_IS_ (err_code, MHD_SCKT_ENOPROTOOPT_) ||
      MHD_SCKT_ERR_IS_ (err_code, MHD_SCKT_ENOTSOCK_))
  {
    if (_MHD_UNKNOWN == connection->is_nonip)
      connection->is_nonip = _MHD_YES;
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    else
    {
      MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
                _ ("Setting %s option to %s state failed "
                   "for TCP/IP socket %d: %s\n"),
                "TCP_NODELAY",
                nodelay_state ? _ ("ON") : _ ("OFF"),
                (int) connection->socket_fd,
                MHD_socket_strerr_ (err_code));
    }
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */
  }
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
  else
  {
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              _ ("Setting %s option to %s state failed: %s\n"),
              "TCP_NODELAY",
              nodelay_state ? _ ("ON") : _ ("OFF"),
              MHD_socket_strerr_ (err_code));
  }
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */

#else  /* ! TCP_NODELAY */
  (void) connection; (void) nodelay_state; /* Mute compiler warnings */
#endif /* ! TCP_NODELAY */
  return false;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No invariant controlling expressions were found. Each C-level controlling expression is runtime-dependent:
- if (_MHD_YES == connection->is_nonip): depends on the mutable field connection->is_nonip.
- if (0 == setsockopt(...)): depends on the return value of the runtime call setsockopt and the ternary (nodelay_state ? &on_val : &off_val) which depends on the nodelay_state parameter.
- if (MHD_SCKT_ERR_IS_(err_code, ... ) || ... ): depends on err_code obtained at runtime from MHD_socket_get_error_(); the macros expand to runtime checks.
- if (_MHD_UNKNOWN == connection->is_nonip): depends on connection->is_nonip.
The #ifdef/#else/#endif preprocessor conditionals (TCP_NODELAY, HAVE_MESSAGES) are not C controlling expressions covered by Rule 14.3. There are no while/for/do-while controlling expressions in this function, and no constant literals (e.g. if(1) or while(0)) used as controlling expressions. Therefore no fragments require further investigation under Rule 14.3.
